intro: Quercus kodaihoensis, commonly known as the Japanese oak, is a deciduous tree native to Japan. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its acorns and lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in temperate climates. Its bark is rugged and gray, while its leaves are broad and have a serrated edge. Quercus kodaihoensis plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
